alert.note: Alert for Calhoun (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 23 at 3:42PM EDT until March 25 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... Chipola River near Altha (CR 274) affecting Calhoun County. For the Chipola River...including Altha (CR 274)...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY EVENING TO FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Chipola River near Altha (CR 274). * WHEN...From Thursday evening to Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding will occur. Lamb Eddy Road near the boat ramp will flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 19.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 22.0 feet tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 22.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 22.0 feet on 04/15/1983. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
